title: 110_s2117
content: The "Education Research & Development To Improve Achievement Act of 2007" is cited as the short title. It amends the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 by adding studies for the development of core programs. The section aims to develop research-proven activities for core Title I programs, including targeted instruction, school improvement, supplemental services, Reading First, and other identified programs. Grants will be awarded to research entities for carrying out these activities through a specified application process. The section requires applications to demonstrate a record of successful educational programs or research, establish clear objectives and benchmarks, develop programs to enhance student achievement, and disseminate research findings. Grant funds must be used for specified purposes by the research and development entity. The grant recipient must use the funds for creating and evaluating new approaches in targeted areas of instruction, school improvement, supplemental educational services, and Reading First. They should also conduct large-scale randomized evaluations of promising activities and existing programs, as well as support nonprofit developers in building capacity for training. The grant recipient must use funds for creating and evaluating new approaches in targeted areas of instruction, school improvement, and Reading First. Grants awarded under this section shall be a minimum of $500,000 annually and continuation depends on meeting objectives and showing promise in program creation and evaluation. Authorization of appropriations is set at $100,000,000 for fiscal year 2008. For fiscal years 2008 to 2013, funding amounts range from $100,000,000 to $150,000,000 or one fifth of the total appropriation for the program, whichever is greater. For fiscal year 2013, funding is set at $150,000,000 or one fifth of the total appropriation for the program, whichever is greater.
